revised_title: Adiabatic Waves in a Rankine Vortex: A Revisit
tldr: This study investigates adiabatic two-dimensional disturbances in a compressible fluid rotating as a Rankine vortex. The research focuses on the low Mach number regime, where it is shown that slow waves in a Rankine vortex in a cylindrical container and in an unbounded vortex are due to a discontinuity in the gradient of the radial component of the disturbance velocity. The study clarifies uncertainties regarding the existence of waves in an unbounded Rankine vortex and provides a simple analytic expression for their growth rates.
